com.sorcix.sirc

Class IrcPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sorcix.sirc.IrcPacket

  • public final class IrcPacket
extends Object
    Parses a raw server response into a more readable format. 
     :<prefix> <command> <receiver> [<arguments>] [:<message>]
    Author:
    Sorcix
    See Also:
    AdvancedListener

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static String CTCP
      CTCP message mark.
      protected static int ERR_UNKNOWNCOMMAND
      Unknown command sent to IRC server.
      protected static int RPL_BOUNCE
      Sent to the client to redirect it to another server.
      protected static int RPL_ENDOFMOTD
      Termination of an RPL_MOTD list.
      protected static int RPL_ENDOFNAMES
      Termination of an RPL_NAMREPLY list.
      protected static int RPL_MOTD
      Reply to MOTD.
      protected static int RPL_NAMREPLY
      Reply to NAMES (See RFC).
      protected static int RPL_TOPIC
      Response to TOPIC with the set topic.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected IrcPacket(String line, IrcConnection irc)
      Creates a new IrcPacket using the data from given raw IRC data.
      protected IrcPacket(String prefix, String command, String arguments, String message)
      Creates a new IrcPacket using given data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IrcPacket

        protected IrcPacket(String line,
         IrcConnection irc)
        Creates a new IrcPacket using the data from given raw IRC data.
        Parameters:
        line - Raw data from the server.
        irc - The IrcConnection used to send messages.

      • IrcPacket

        protected IrcPacket(String prefix,
         String command,
         String arguments,
         String message)
        Creates a new IrcPacket using given data.
        Parameters:
        prefix - The prefix, or null.
        command - The command
        arguments - A space separated arguments list, or null.
        message - The message, or null.

    • Method Detail

      • getArguments

        public String getArguments()
        Gives the arguments parsed from this raw server line.
        Returns:
        Arguments string, or null if there were none.

      • getArgumentsArray

        public String[] getArgumentsArray()
        Gives the arguments as an array.
        Returns:
        Arguments array, or null if there were none.

      • getCommand

        public String getCommand()
        Gives the command parsed from this raw server line.
        Returns:
        The command string.

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage()
        Gives the message parsed from this raw server line.
        Returns:
        Message string, or null if there was none.

      • getNumericCommand

        public int getNumericCommand()
        Gives the command parsed from this raw server line.
        Returns:
        The command integer.

      • getPrefix

        public String getPrefix()
        Gives the prefix of this packet. This usually is the sender of a message. You might be able to use getSender() instead.
        Returns:
        The sender string.

      • getRaw

        protected String getRaw()
        Generates a raw IRC packet.
        Returns:
        IRC String containing the data in this object.

      • getSender

        public User getSender()
        Returns the User that caused the server to send this packet.
        Returns:
        Sender User, or null if the sender was not a user.

      • hasArguments

        public boolean hasArguments()
        Checks whether this line had arguments.
        Returns:
        True if there were arguments.

      • hasMessage

        public boolean hasMessage()
        Checks whether this line had a message.
        Returns:
        True if there was a message.

      • isCtcp

        public boolean isCtcp()
        Checks whether this command is a CTCP command.
        Returns:
        True if this message was sent using CTCP, false otherwise.

      • isNumeric

        public boolean isNumeric()
        Checks if this server line is a numeric reply.
        Returns:
        True if this line is a numeric reply.
